text: 1. two or more nullable productions for a given nonterminal, or 2. overlapping FIRST sets for the productions of a nonterminal, or 3. a FIRST set for a non-nullable production that overlaps with the set of characters that makes a nullable production for the same nonterminal a valid choice. Note that while absence of such conflicts proves that a grammar is unambiguous, presence of such conflicts does not prove that a grammar is ambiguous.
